thread.title: Elections Canada says 3.6 million votes cast during advance polls
thread.title_full: Elections Canada says 3.6 million votes cast during advance polls

author: CBC News
title: Elections Canada says 3.6 million votes cast during advance polls
text:
Breaking Elections Canada says 3.6 million votes cast during advance polls CBC News Posted: Oct 13, 2015 5:18 PM ET Last Updated: Oct 13, 2015 5:33 PM ET Advance polls open at River Oaks Recreational Centre in Oakville, Ont., on Oct. 11. (Michelle-Andrea Girouard/CBC) Related Stories Advance poll turnout over 3 days up 16% from 2011 
Elections Canada says an estimated 3.6 million people voted during four days of advance polls running from Friday to Thanksgiving Monday, representing a 71 per cent increase over three days of advance polling in 2011. 
The agency estimated that 1.2 million people voted on Thanksgiving Monday, 767,000 on Sunday, 780,000 on Saturday and 850,000 on Friday. 
More to come
